speaker: Rhae
message: Soooo Ladies, do tell, how was your date with the Prince?

speaker: Chessa
message: I thought it went wonderfully - he is a man of many layers and I like that.

speaker: Sienna
message: Yes - he has a certain strength to him that I find endearing.

speaker: Wilhelmina
message: Indeed, every part of him embodies what it means to be royalty.

speaker: Rhae
message: Goodness, I must say; I wasn't expecting such... [i]enthusiasm.[/i]

speaker: Sienna
message: How could we not be excited? He is a prince you know...

speaker: Sienna
message: ...and a mighty powerful one at that!

speaker: Rhae
message: [i](Maybe I can use this to my advantage... it's time to play matchmaker)

speaker: Rhae
message: I suppose I get where you are coming from... On our date today he did tell me about:
prompts: The time he ate all of his siblings.
His obsessive belief in the powers of Horse Milk.
The tomes of poetry he has written through the years.

responses.speaker: Sienna
responses.message: Oh ho that rascal he most certainly did not! See, that's what I love about him. I have always thought that every loving relationship should be a power struggle. If you aren't vying to be on top what's the point?

responses.speaker: Sienna
responses.message: Horse milk? No offense Rhae I fear he might have been telling you these things to protect you from his true self. The Gog I know is a much stronger, fiercer man.

responses.speaker: Sienna
responses.message: Surely you jest? You must have misunderstood him, you should really take this more seriously Rhae. The Gog I know is a much stronger, fiercer man.

responses.speaker: Sienna
responses.message: He talked to you about his attendant? Hahaha look out Rhae I fear our prince might be trying to set you up! He probably can tell you lack the strength and cut throat nature to run a country.

speaker: Chessa
message: My, my Sienna how very... expected of you. Domineering as ever. I fear your missing so much of our dear Gog though. He has a mystifying depth when you actually bother to look.

speaker: Rhae
message: [i](Depth? She can't be serious... the man is shallower than the pool he spawned from!)[/i]

speaker: Rhae
message: Oh, Chessa love, how right you are. You'd love to hear about:
prompts: All the in-depth details of his fratricidal vorescapades. I know all the names... and textures...
The never-ending list of health benefits offered by consuming Pounds of Horse Milk
The fact that I haven't even begun to exhaust the poetry he recited for me.
How Crumbit sleeps in a foot locker by the princes bed in case he is needed at night.

responses.speaker: Chessa
responses.message: I can think of nothing I wish to hear of less. Though I suppose that belies his choosing that for you. Trying to chase you away, it would seem. The man I met was deeper than the vastest of oceans.

responses.speaker: Chessa
responses.message: I suppose I can understand the worth in such information, but really Rhae? Horse Milk? Where is the romance in [i]that?[/i] The man I met was deeper than the vastest of oceans.

responses.speaker: Chessa
responses.message: Now you are speaking my language... the poetic language of love! The first time I read Mouser's "The Ratebury Tales," I immediately understood what it meant to [i]truly [b]feel[/b][/i]. The depth to the piece was so immense that I felt as if I could drown.

responses.speaker: Chessa
responses.message: He told you a shocking amount about his butler... I feel sorry for you Rhae. In our date, he told me tales that made me fall for him immediately. My Gog was deeper than the vastest ocean.

speaker: Wilhelmina
message: Hah Chessa dear, do you not think that a bit melodramatic? Nothing wrong with a man of intellect, of course, but really when it comes to finding a suitor there is nothing more important than [i]pedigree.[/i]

speaker: Rhae
message: How right you are Wilhelmina. And nothing says pedigree like:
prompts: Jerome getting stuck in his throat due to an "Unwieldy Tail Bone"
The fact that Horse Milk is far more viscous than other milks.
Starting most of his poems with "there once was a man from Mucktucket..."
I swear he would call him “Crumpet” sometimes...

responses.speaker: Wilhelmina
responses.message: Love... you sound famished, maybe have a biscuit with some of that tea, and take a lap. I'm more interested in his upbringing and making sure his background meets my needs.

responses.speaker: Wilhelmina
responses.message: Yes see! This is what I love. A man with a strong upbringing. It takes a strong family to know the importance of a horse centric childhood, his mother clearly raised him well. I too was raised in such a way and in my schooling days I was the pride of the chariot team.

responses.speaker: Wilhelmina
responses.message: Rhae, I finished schooling and never looked back, no need for poetry and philosophy. I'm more interested in his upbringing and making sure his background meets my needs.

responses.speaker: Wilhelmina
responses.message: Rhae, having an attendant is important for [i]any[/i] member of the royalty, little though I care for... Crambot? I want to know more about the prince's upbringing, and making sure his background meets my needs.

speaker: Sienna
message: That's a fancy way of saying she's in it for money and clout.

speaker: Rhae
message: Well ladies this has been truly enlightening. Sounds as though our next round of dates is this weekend.

speaker: Rhae
message: Same time next week for tea?
